multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
My fingernails and toenails have become very rough, they have lost their shine, and they show deep lines running along their length.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin or any other parts of your body?
No, my skin, hair, and the inside of my mouth all look normal.
When did you first notice the changes in your nails?
The changes in my nails started a few months ago.
Do you have any chronic health conditions or are you currently taking any medication?
No, I don't have any history of medical problems and I'm not taking any medications.
Does anyone in your family have similar nail issues or any other dermatological conditions?
No, there is no family history of skin diseases.
Have you experienced any recent trauma or injury to your nails, or been exposed frequently to water or chemicals?
No, I haven't experienced any recent trauma, injury, or frequent exposure to water or chemicals.
Final Diagnosis: Onychorrhexis
